abstract: Jim Dywer About New York column; Ibrahim O Dabbashi, Libya’s deputy permanent representative to the United Nations, who broke with the regime a week into the protests, calling Col Muammar el-Qaddafi a criminal, speaks out on news of Qaddafi's death.
snippet: Ibrahim O. Dabbashi, Libya’s deputy permanent representative to the United Nations, broke with the regime, calling Muammar el-Qaddafi a criminal.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Ibrahim O. Dabbashi, Libya’s deputy permanent representative to the United Nations, broke with the regime, calling Muammar el-Qaddafi a criminal.

headline.main: Speaking for Qaddafi, Then Denouncing Him
headline.seo: Speaking for Qaddafi, Then Denouncing Him
